meanings.definition: The sport or practice of fighting with the fists, especially as a form of organized sport.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy watching boxing matches on TV.
meanings.sent2: He trained hard to become a professional boxer.
meanings.sent3: The boxing match was so intense, it felt like the boxers were dancing.
meanings.sent4: In the boxing ring, each punch tells a story of determination and skill.
meanings.sent5: The sound of boxing gloves hitting the bag echoed through the gym.

meanings.definition: The act of putting something into a box.
meanings.sent1: She started boxing up her old books for donation.
meanings.sent2: After packing, the fragile items needed careful boxing.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was a game and kept boxing the toy into the box.
meanings.sent4: He carefully labeled each box after boxing up his belongings.
meanings.sent5: The moving crew efficiently handled the boxing of all the items.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing or enclosing in a box.
meanings.sent1: The boxing of the gift made it look presentable.
meanings.sent2: They were tasked with boxing the delicate glassware for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain forced them to quickly start boxing the equipment.
meanings.sent4: She found joy in boxing up memories to keep them safe.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to finish the boxing of the items before the deadline.
